It’s 25 years since legendary Queen frontman Freddie Mercury passed away, but today his music lives on in more forms than ever - including on our online music platform, Freegal, which you can access for free with your library card. If you’re in the mood for a bit of Queen, or indeed any 80s or classic rock music today, why not try one of these titles?

Classic Dream Orchestra - Greatest Hits Go Classic: Queen

Classic Dream Orchestra present Queen hits like you’ve never heard them before! It’s amazing how different - yet recognisable - popular songs you’ve heard hundreds of times sound when played on classical instruments. We also have Greatest Hits Go Classic versions of songs by Phil Collins, Elton John, The Beatles and more.

Various - Eddie Stobart Trucking Songs: Trucking All Over the World

This album starts with Another One Bites the Dust and also includes classic songs by Status Quo, Bob Dylan, Johnny Cash, Stereophonics, The Cure, Kasabian and many more! With 57 tracks there is something for everyone.

Various - The 80s, Part 2

This essential 80s compilation opens with A Kind Of Magic. Other 80s classics on the album include Tainted Love</cite< by Soft Cell, True Faith by New Order and Just Can’t Get Enough by Depeche Mode.

[Various - Eddie Stobart Trucking Songs</cite<](http://suffolklibraries.freegalmusic.com/artists/view/27695248/c29ueQ)

This great compilation album includes Don’t Stop Me Now, as well as great tracks from the likes of Thin Lizzy, Meat Loaf, Fleetwood Mac and Toto. Perfect for Friday drivetime.
